text: My recent trip to Shanghai Disneyland was dominated by the incredible thrill rides in Tomorrowland. The standout attraction is undoubtedly the TRON Lightcycle Power Run, which is a high-speed roller coaster located in the heart of Tomorrowland. The launch sequence is intense, and the futuristic visual effects are stunning. Because TRON Lightcycle Power Run is so popular, the standby wait time reached 90 minutes by noon. To avoid the queue, I purchased Disney Premier Access for this specific ride. After TRON, I walked over to Adventure Isle to ride Roaring Rapids. Roaring Rapids involves getting wet, so visitors should bring a raincoat. Adventure Isle also houses Soaring Over the Horizon, a flight simulator that offers amazing views of global landmarks. However, Soaring Over the Horizon had a 120-minute wait, which was too long for me. I finished the day at Treasure Cove, where I experienced Pirates of the Caribbean: Battle for the Sunken Treasure. This attraction uses advanced projection technology and magnetic boats, making it significantly better than older versions in other parks.

I visited Shanghai Disneyland primarily to see the new Zootopia land. Zootopia is situated next to Fantasyland and is incredibly immersive. The main attraction there is Zootopia: Hot Pursuit, a trackless ride that features characters like Judy Hopps and Nick Wilde. The queue for Zootopia: Hot Pursuit is very detailed, featuring an animatronic Officer Clawhauser. Outside the ride, I bought a Pawpsicle from a street vendor; the Pawpsicle is a hawthorn-flavored ice cream bar shaped like a paw. For lunch, we went to Jumbeaux's Cafe, which serves donuts and blueberry pies. Aside from Zootopia, we spent time in Fantasyland. We rode the Seven Dwarfs Mine Train, which is a family-friendly coaster suitable for children. The Seven Dwarfs Mine Train often has long lines, so we used the Single Rider line to save time. We also visited the Enchanted Storybook Castle, which is the largest Disney castle in the world and serves as the central landmark of the park.

The dining and shopping experiences at Shanghai Disneyland are distinct compared to other Disney parks. I started my day at Mickey Avenue, which is the main entry corridor filled with shops. I went into the Avenue M Arcade to buy merchandise related to Duffy and Friends. Specifically, LinaBell plush toys are extremely popular here and were limited to two per customer. For breakfast, I stopped by CookieAnn Bakery Cafe on Mickey Avenue to get a Mickey-shaped waffle. Later in the day, I looked for a substantial meal and chose Barbossa's Bounty. Barbossa's Bounty is a quick-service restaurant located in Treasure Cove. The signature dish at Barbossa's Bounty is the BBQ Pork Ribs, which comes with corn and rice. It is unique because the dining area overlooks the water track of the Pirates of the Caribbean ride. For a snack, I bought a Turkey Leg at the kiosk in Adventure Isle, but be warned that the Turkey Leg is very oily and huge.

Our family stayed at the Toy Story Hotel to get the full resort experience. The Toy Story Hotel is located just outside the park gates and offers a complimentary shuttle bus service to the main entrance. A major benefit of staying at the Toy Story Hotel is the Early Park Entry, which allowed us to enter Shanghai Disneyland one hour before the general public. We used this extra time to rush to Tomorrowland. My kids loved the Buzz Lightyear Planet Rescue, which is an interactive shooting game. After that, we went to the Gardens of Imagination to ride the Fantasia Carousel. The Gardens of Imagination is located directly in front of the Enchanted Storybook Castle. At 3:30 PM, we watched Mickey's Storybook Express, a parade that runs through the longest parade route of any Disney park. The parade features Mulan on a large horse float. We ended the night watching ILLUMINATE! A Nighttime Celebration, a fireworks and projection show displayed on the castle.

I focused my Shanghai Disneyland visit on shows and entertainment rather than just rides. I highly recommend watching Eye of the Storm: Captain Jack's Stunt Spectacular. This show is located in the El Teatro theatre within Treasure Cove and features live stunts and sword fighting. It is much more action-packed than the Frozen: A Sing-Along Celebration in Fantasyland, which is better suited for younger children who like singing. I also explored the Camp Discovery challenge trails in Adventure Isle. Camp Discovery requires guests to wear a harness and traverse rope bridges. It is physically demanding but offers great views of the Roaring Rapids mountain. For dinner, I booked a table at the Royal Banquet Hall inside the Enchanted Storybook Castle. The Royal Banquet Hall is a table-service restaurant that requires a reservation weeks in advance. During the meal, characters like Mickey Mouse and Minnie Mouse visited our table for photos. The price for the Royal Banquet Hall is high, but the interaction is worth it.
